title: Simulation Theory-Meth
description: Theory, algorithms, and applications of computer simulation. Topics include generalized semi-Markov processes; input-output analysis; random number, variate, and sample path generation; variance reduction techniques; and optimization via simulation.  This course is intended for Ph.D. students.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Cannot be enrolled in one of the following Levels:
__HEADER_1__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: ISYE 2028 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and ISYE 6761 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 6761 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
